{"step_by_step_thinking": "Radiation effects are cumulative, meaning they build up over time. Each exposure to radiation adds to an individual's risk of developing cancer or other serious health conditions. While radiation effects can also be dependent on the genetic makeup of individuals, the question seems to be asking about the general effect of radiation, not how it affects different individuals. Therefore, the most accurate answer would be that the effect of radiation is cumulative.", "answer_choice": "A"}
